SEARCH
Package SC2002.Project.entity

Class Applicant

java.lang.Object
SC2002.Project.entity.User
SC2002.Project.entity.Applicant
Direct Known Subclasses:
HDB_Officer
public class Applicant extends User
Represents an applicant user in the BTO system.

This class implements the Applicant role in the BTO system, which includes:

  • Viewing eligible projects based on marital status and age
  • Applying for BTO projects
  • Managing application status (including withdrawals)
  • Booking flats through HDB Officers
  • Creating and managing enquiries

Fulfills the following requirements:

  • Can apply for projects (only one at a time)
  • Singles (35+ years) can only apply for 2-Room flats
  • Married (21+ years) can apply for any flat type (2-Room or 3-Room)
  • View project details and application status
  • Book flats if application is successful
  • Request withdrawal of BTO applications
  • Submit and manage enquiries

  • Constructor Details

    • Applicant

      public Applicant(String nric, String firstName, String lastName, MaritalStatus maritalStatus, int age)
      Constructs a new Applicant and assigns a unique ID.
      Parameters:
      nric - The applicant's NRIC (unique identifier)
      firstName - The applicant's first name
      lastName - The applicant's last name (can be empty)
      maritalStatus - The applicant's marital status (SINGLE or MARRIED)
      age - The applicant's age

      Returns:
      This applicant's unique ID

    • getCurrentApplication

      public Optional<BTOApplication> getCurrentApplication()
      Gets the applicant's current active application if one exists. This is used to enforce the requirement that applicants can only have one active application at a time.
      Returns:
      An Optional containing the active BTO application, or empty if none exists

    • setCurrentApplication

      public void setCurrentApplication(BTOApplication application)
      Sets a new active application for the applicant. If a previous application existed, it is added to history. This method helps fulfill the requirement that applicants can only have one active application at a time.
      Parameters:
      application - The new application to set as current

    • getApplicationHistory

      public List<BTOApplication> getApplicationHistory()
      Gets the history of the applicant's past applications.
      Returns:
      An unmodifiable list of past applications

    • finalizeWithdrawal

      public void finalizeWithdrawal()
      Moves a withdrawn application into history and clears the currentApplication. Fulfills the requirement for applicants to withdraw their applications.

    • clearCurrentApplicationReference

      public void clearCurrentApplicationReference()
      Clears the current application reference after rejection/withdrawal. Ensures it's already in history. This enables the applicant to apply for a new project after withdrawal or rejection of their previous application.
